title: Driver and Transportation Analytics Lab
author: Behzad Aghdashi
description: provides analytical facilities to analyze big data, visualization, and predictions in transportation industry. This page serves as a central point to connect to different tools developed in ITRE's DATA Lab. For all tools developed in DaTA lab, a link is placed in this screen. Different tools will have a different authentication method. If you need access to these tools, please contact Behzad Aghdashi at
header_contact: If you need access to these tools, please contact

tools.title: Peak Spreading Tool
tools.description: This tool provides a analytical approach based on NCHRP 765 for analysis of demand peaks

tools.title: Interactive Traffic Violation Video Archive
tools.description: this tool provides a central resource to search for a variaty of traffic violations video footage in Wake county

tools.title: BiPed Analytics
tools.description: The online BiPed Analytics tool provides a comprehensive set of facilities to collect pedestrian and bicycle counts along with validation, applying correction factors, and converting them to TMG format

tools.title: On-Ramp Signal's Evaluation Tool
tools.description: This tool is designed to help NCDOT and its stakeholders to analyze the operation of on-ramp signals in NC

tools.title: CostVal
tools.description: CostVal or Intersection lifecycle analysis tool provides facilities to evaluate life cycle costs for different intersection alternatives.

tools.title: Signal Prioritization (SPM)
tools.description: The NCDOT's cloud based signal prioritization tool provide facilities to NCDOT staff and engineers to prioritize signal timing plans change.

tools.title: FREEVAL
tools.description: FREEVAL is the official computational engine for freeway facilities analysis based on the 6th edition of Highway Capacity Manual (HCM).

tools.title: STREETVAL
tools.description: STREETVAL is the official computational engine for freeway facilities analysis based on the 6th edition of Highway Capacity Manual (HCM).
